clinical_study.official_title: A Brief Tailored Family-centered Seatbelt Intervention for Hospitalized Trauma

brief_summary.textblock: The study will use a randomized controlled design testing the effectiveness of the following intervention: (i) intervener brief intervention (IBI) vs. (ii) Enhanced usual care (EUC). The study will identify children ages 2-14 at a pediatric trauma center. Children and their parents who agree to participate in the study will then complete a screening survey to identify part time seatbelt use. Those who screen positive will complete a more detailed baseline survey and then be randomized to one of two study conditions. At one month, a follow up assessment by telephone will be completed.

primary_outcome.description: Follow up telephone assessment on full time seat belt use by parent and child
Follow up telephone assessment on level of knowledge of seat belt use and risk factors
Follow up telephone assessment of positive attitude, motivation, and self-efficacy regarding safety restraint use.

clinical_study.condition: High Risk Population of Part-time Seatbelt Users

arm_group.description: Subjects and parents will complete a Brief Motivational Interview (BMI) incorporating personalized feedback, discussion of choices and changes, and therapist led intervention message relating behavioral change and future goals.
Subjects and parents will receive standard trauma care, plus complete brief questionnaires and receive general safety information.

intervention.intervention_name: Interactive interview and tailored family centered seatbelt safety intervention

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children ages 7-14 and their parent or guardian, at a pediatric trauma center
- Child admitted to hospital with diagnosis of injury other than sexual assault and suicide
- Identify as part time seat belt users
